body:
Oh that is indeed a **very** long time.
I'll look into adding a pause function for the program, but it would take me a while as I'm busy handling some contests right now.

Just to make sure, are you using `--gpu` or `--cudnn`?

With `--cudnn`, I am getting around `3.02s/it`, or around 28h for the episode.

With `--gpu`, it is around `4.20s/it`, or about 38 hours per episode.

The waifu2x command looks like:
```
C:/Program Files (x86)/waifu2x-caffe/waifu2x-caffe-cui.exe" -p cudnn -I png -i C:\Users\StarSwirl\video2x\frames\extracted_1.png -e png -o C:\Users\StarSwirl\video2x\upscaled\extracted_1.png -w 1280 -h 960 -n 0 -m noise_scale -y anime_style_art_rgb
```

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/202527/46246754-263cc000-c40b-11e8-9809-80e2f059414d.png)

Looking at this usage pattern, I suspected that we were losing a lot of time to start/stop. Indeed, when I started the same process through `waifu2x-caffee` manually (with the gui) I got just over 3 hours to convert all frames. This means that we shouldn't be executing separate commands for each image individually, but do a batch conversion.
Switching to `upconv_7_anime_style_art_rgb` model, I can complete the waifu2x step of full episode in 1:37h or so. Invoking `waifu2x-caffee-cui.exe` per image is definitely a HUGE waste of resources.
Since waifu2x-caffee-cui has STDOUT of one line per image, we can probably still track progress with a bit of effort I think.
I will push the current version for you to see if it makes any difference for your videos.

@VanTanev Also, for batch conversion, waifu2x engine only gives one "success" message for the entire conversion. Therefore I don't think I'll be able to make a progress bar without sacrificing (killing) the performance.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/21986859/46247263-d7753300-c3d6-11e8-9261-a52664dbce31.png)
@VanTanev I have pushed the code into the repo. Try it out!

I forgot that this is not just about the batch conversion, but also the resuming function.
I'll reopen the issue and keep working on it.

@VanTanev I just thought this through again. The enlarging process is taken care of by waifu2x. Therefore, I don't think there's anything that I can do unless I process each separately, which as you said, will cause the efficiency to drop drastically.

I think about the performance too..my gtx 1080 chills and I can hear (yes) everything my pc do..and I hear every image is processed. And my gpu don't is used very much. 

So can we make it more "multithreaded"? Not frame by frame more like x frames at one time. Or x videos at the same time? 

Would love to say..hey..here is my folder with x video files..go for it and make magic :P
All the enlarging are handled by the waifu2x-caffe binary. I'm not sure if we can multi-thread this thing.

https://github.com/imPRAGMA/W2XKit

PRAGMA's similar program let's you define how many threads waifu2x uses at
once.

On Sun, Oct 21, 2018, 4:47 PM K4YT3X <notifications@github.com> wrote:

> All the enlarging are handled by the waifu2x-caffe binary. I'm not sure if
> we can multi-thread this thing.
>
